1:
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,\q but the one who hates correction is stupid.
\q
2:
Yahweh gives favor to a good man,\q but he condemns a man who makes evil plans.

\q
3:
A person cannot be established by wickedness,\q but righteous people cannot be uprooted.
\q
4:
A worthy wife is her husband's crown,\q but she who brings shame is like a disease that rots his bones.


\q
5:
The plans of the righteous are just,\q but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
\q
6:
The words of wicked people are an ambush waiting for a chance to kill,\q but the words of the upright keep them safe.


\q
7:
Wicked people are overthrown and they are gone,\q but the house of the righteous person will stand.
\q
8:
A person is praised by how much wisdom he has,\q but the one who makes perverse choices is despised.


\q
9:
Better to have an unimportant position—only being a servant—\q than to brag about your importance but have no food.
\q
10:
The righteous person cares about the needs of his animal,\q but even the compassion of the wicked is cruel.


\q
11:
The one who works his land will have plenty of food,\q but whoever chases after worthless projects has no sense.
\q
12:
The wicked person desires what evil men have stolen from others,\q but the fruit of righteous people comes from themselves.


\q
13:
An evil person is trapped by his wicked talk,\q but the righteous person escapes from trouble.
\q
14:
From the fruit of his words a person is filled with good things,\q just as the work of his hands rewards him.

\q
15:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,\q but a wise man listens to advice.
\q
16:
A fool shows his anger at once,\q but one who ignores an insult is prudent.

\q
17:
The one who speaks the truth says what is right,\q but a false witness tells lies.
\q
18:
The words of one who speaks rashly are like the thrusts of a sword,\q but the tongue of the wise brings healing.


\q
19:
Truthful lips last forever,\q but a lying tongue is only for a moment.
\q
20:
There is deceit in the hearts of those who plan to do evil,\q but joy comes to the advisors of peace.


\q
21:
No ill comes on the righteous person,\q but wicked people are filled with difficulties.
\q
22:
Yahweh hates lying lips,\q but those who live faithfully are his delight.


\q
23:
A prudent man conceals his knowledge,\q but the heart of fools shouts out folly.
\q
24:
The hand of the diligent will rule,\q but lazy people will be put to forced labor.


\q
25:
Anxiety in the heart of a person weighs him down,\q but a good word makes him glad.
\q
26:
The righteous person is a guide for his friend,\q but the way of the wicked leads them astray.


\q
27:
Lazy people would not roast their own game,\q but the diligent man will obtain precious wealth.
\q
28: Those who walk in the right way find life\q and in its path there is no death.
